attributes.action: Give GCSE and A-Level 2022 students reduced content exams.
attributes.additional_details:
With hope, by the time of the 2022 exam series, it will be safe to sit exams as the situation with COVID-19 will have hopefully improved. However, this does not overrule the fact that GCSE and A-Level students are still at a disadvantage as they’ve missed many critical months of their education to online learning. Online learning hinders students’ ability to learn and work to the best of their ability, so this should be made up for with reduced exam content.

With credits to FA.
attributes.background: Prior to the cancellation of the 2021 summer exam series, students were due to receive exams with reduced content as a result of the time they’d missed. Students due to take exams in the 2022 series have also missed a considerable amount of time and their education has been severely disrupted.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566803

Exam arrangements and the current coronavirus pandemic can cause worry and stress. You can find information on how to deal with stress here:

Young Minds: https://youngminds.org.uk

Children’s Society: https://www.childrenssociety.org.uk/mental-health-advice-for-children-and-young-people/issues-affecting-young-people

Childline: https://www.childline.org.uk/info-advice/your-feelings/anxiety-stress-panic/coping-with-stress/
